name: All's Hallow
description:
You're Clyde, a friendly ghost who is tasked at restoring your village to its former All Hallow's Eve celebrating glory.  Find collectibles, complete quests, and defeat the boss all in a nights work!

*TO NAVIGATE IN-GAME MENUS*

KEYBOARD/CONTROLLER

T/SELECT - Cycle through menus/options

R/START - Selects option that is highlighted

 - For a full list of the controller/keyboard inputs, please see "Controls" found on the "Options" menu -

*This game was more of an experiment and learning experience for me as a developer.  I've always worked in 2D and decided to give my skills a test. So I went ahead and designed a small 3D platformer, reminiscent of the N64 era.  Due to wanting to release this before Halloween 18' there is still a lot to do so  you may encounter some bugs. I hope this is still enjoyable overall and any and all feedback is appreciated!*

 - SDISAG

*THIS IS NOT A FINISHED PROJECT - There's still work to be done but I wanted to get it out before Halloween so it could be enjoyed for the holiday.  Stay tuned for possible future updates*

- NPC dialogue change after receiving/completing quests

- Improve and tighten up boss fight mechanics

- Add more collectibles

- Increase level size, add main hub with more levels

- Input customization

- Option to turn music on/off (is disabled due to a bug)

If YOU, the player, have any suggestions on how to improve this game or have any ideas for features you think should be added, please comment below and let me know!

- Can I use a game pad?

Yes!  The game was specifically designed for use with an Xbox One controller, although a keyboard & mouse will work just as well.  No other game pads have been tested, so others may/may not work.

- Where can I find more of your work?

If you'd like to stay up to date with what I'm doing and creating please give me a follow on Twitter!  You can find a link on my profile page or just search Sdisag!

 - If I donate, where does that money go? 

Any donations will go into to helping me fund future projects!
